Following the path of the Florida panther | Fighting to

posts.description: The Forgotten Coast Film about Florida Wildlife Corridor #Glades2Gulf Expedition is now available nationwide on PBS! Click the link in my bio to stream it online. Also check the PBS app on Apple TV, Amazon etc. Please watch and share this journey to #KeepFLWild @fl_wildcorridor @the_explorers_club @ilcp_photographers @natgeo

This Earth Day I am thankful for the Florida black bear whose large landscape movements documented by biologist Joseph Guthrie and colleagues inspired the Florida Wildlife Corridor campaign. Like the Florida panther, the wide ranging Florida black bear shows people the lands we need to protect to save the Corridor and #KeepFLWild. This photo is from a camera trap at Florida Panther National Wildlife Refuge. @fl_wildcorridor @joeguthrie8 @ilcp_photographers @natgeocreative #pathofthepanther #floridawild

A coyote triggers one of my camera traps in a cypress swamp at Babcock Ranch State Preserve. I've only seen 2 or 3 coyotes during the past year camera trapping in South Florida. Coyotes are numerous further north in Florida, which doesn't seem to be the case in panther country. Biologist friends have suggested that expansion of panthers to the north could put the coyote population in check there too, perhaps as a net benefit to cattle ranchers. #floridawild #keepflwild #pathofthepanther @fl_wildcorridor @ilcp_photographers

Nice when a panther gives a good look to your camera in the swamp. This frame transmitted by @bushnell_official wireless. Can't wait to see the photo on my Nikon in that camera box! #pathofthepanther #keepFLWild

This week a 7500 acre wild fire swept across private lands between Picayune Strand State Forest and the boundary of suburban development sprawling inland from Naples, Florida. Heavy fuel loads combined with stiff winds made the blaze difficult to contain. Several neighborhoods were evacuated and a stretch of Interstate 75, bottom right, was closed for two days. Greater budgets for habitat management, including more frequent prescribed fires, can help prevent wild fires from burning out of control. Flying over this fire also reminded me that protecting more land in the Florida Wildlife Corridor can help steer new developments away from large wildlands, making more frequent fires feasible and reducing the risk to people when fires do occur. @fl_wildcorridor @freshfromflorida #fire #leewilliamsrdfire #keepflwild #floridawild #everglades

Longleaf pine savannas are among the Earth's most biologically diverse habitats. There was once 90 million acres of longleaf across the southeastern United States. Logging cut that back to 3 million acres and conservationists are now working to restore more longleaf to the landscape. One restoration success is The Nature Conservancy's Disney Wilderness Preserve, near Orlando, where improved wildlife habitat is also providing water-cleansing wetlands in the Everglades Headwaters. @fl_wildcorridor @nature_org @natureflorida #floridawildlifecorridor #keepflwild

Thanks to conservation flight organization Lighthawk for making this photo possible. #viewfromabove #florida #conservation #conservationphotography @ilcp_photographers #aerialphotography #aviation #aviationphotography #naturelovers #floridawild #keepflwild #floridawildlifecorridor #tbt

My cousin, Lefty Durando, has written an important editorial about the importance of protecting Florida ranches from development (link in my bio). "We want long-term options to keep our lands natural and keep them from being turned into roof tops." I am thankful for Lefty's leadership and other Florida cowboy heroes who are our best hope of protecting the @fl_wildcorridor and keeping Florida wild. This photo is from a few years back during a roundup at the Durando Ranch in the Everglades headwaters. #livingheritage #evergladescowboy #evergladesheadwaters #floridawildlifecorridor #floridawild #keepflwild
A Florida black bear navigates pine prairie at Florida Panther National Wildlife Refuge. #floridawildlifecorridor #pathofthepanther #floridawild #keepflwild #bear
Ghost orchids in bloom, upper Fakahatchee, Florida Panther National Wildlife Refuge. Happy Valentines Day! #floridawildlifecorridor #floridawild #keepflwild #pathofthepanther #orchid #ghostorchid
